A new study reaffirms that although severe coronavirus illness and death impact the elderly the most, younger adults are the cause of the spread.

articles.title: A Proclamation on American Heart Month, 2021 - The White House
articles.description: Tragically, heart disease continues to be a leading cause of death in the United States.  It affects Americans of all genders, races, and ethnicities.  Yet despite being one of the country’s most costly and deadly diseases, it is among the most preventable.  …

articles.author: Adrianna Rodriguez, USA TODAY
articles.title: People who smoke are prioritized to get the COVID-19 vaccine before the general population - Yahoo! Voices
articles.description: Studies have found that people who smoke are more likely to be hospitalized or die from COVID-19 than people who haven't smoked.
articles.content:
As more Americans anxiously wait their turn to get the COVID-19 vaccine, people are discovering that smokers are one of the priority groups for vaccination.
Some dont agree with the guidance and hav… [+3792 chars]
